Title: Exchange rate falls to N993/$1, lowest level ever on official NAFEM
Summary:
- The exchange rate between the naira and dollar reached its lowest level ever on NAFEM.
- The naira depreciated by 20.5% against the dollar, marking a record low.
- The black market exchange rate has shown appreciation over the past three trading days, in contrast to the official market.

Title: Naira Further Appreciates To N1,150/$1 At Parallel FX Market - OsunDefender
Summary:
- The Nigerian Naira has appreciated to N1,150 against the US dollar at the parallel market.
- This represents a 6.5% increase compared to the previous trading day.
- The scarcity of the dollar is starting to impact the black market, with more dollars gradually returning to the market.

Title: Naira gains Dollar falls further to N1,170
Summary:
- The Naira strengthened by 2.5% against the dollar on the parallel market, reaching N1,170.
- The appreciation of the Naira is attributed to government policies aimed at discouraging speculative demands and hoarding of foreign exchange.
- The foreign exchange market saw significant dollar flows, leading to a 129.50% increase in daily turnover.

Title: Nigeria Exchange Soars 1.45% on Solid Q3 Results
Summary:
- The Nigerian Exchange (NGX) saw a 1.45% growth in its first trading session, driven by sustained buying pressure and renewed investor interest.
- Traders were buying shares across sectors in anticipation of higher returns on investment in the coming weeks.
- The market capitalization grew by N536 billion to N37.421 trillion, and the trading volume, value, and number of deals all increased significantly.

Title: FG Mulls Cassava as Import Substitution for Wheat Flour, Bio-Oil
Summary:
- Nigeria aims to use its position as the largest producer of cassava to substitute imported wheat flour, corn starch, and bio-oil.
- The Minister of Agriculture and Food Security highlighted challenges in the production of high-quality cassava flour, including the high cost and inefficiency of flash dryers.
- The government advocates for training stakeholders on the use of cassava flour in baking, improving flash dryers, and implementing quality control systems to increase demand and enhance efficiency in the cassava subsector.

Title: Please Enable Cookies
Summary:
- www.industryweek.com is using a security service to protect against online attacks.
- Full cookie support is required to view the website.
- The security service will redirect users once validation is complete.

Title: Access Bank to drive business empowerment with specialised products, services â€“ The Sun Nigeria
Summary:
Access Bank has announced its intention to provide specialized financial products and services to businesses, NGOs, and institutions as part of its Development Banking Desk initiative.
The bank aims to support and nurture the growth of these entities, fostering a robust entrepreneurial ecosystem in Nigeria and beyond.
The Development Desk serves as a conduit for global funds and resources, bolstering the bank's influence in the African region and fortifying Nigeria's position on the international development stage.

Title: Shelter Afrique Development Bank Extends US$12m Loan To Vista Bank Guinee
Summary:
- Shelter Afrique Development Bank has approved a $12 million line of credit for Vista Bank Guinee SA in Guinea.
- The funds will be used to finance affordable housing projects, including SMEs in the housing value chain.
- The loan agreement allows developers a maximum of 2 years to execute projects, with beneficiaries given 8 years to repay.

Title: Consumers lament hike in gas price
Summary:
- Residents of Mowe in Ogun State are facing hardship due to the high price of cooking gas, which has affected their standard of living.
- The rise in the dollar exchange rate with the naira is being blamed for the increase in gas prices by local traders.
- The high cost of cooking gas has led to reduced business for traders and has forced consumers to use alternative fuels like firewood and charcoal.
